results.title: Efonidipine reduces proteinuria and plasma aldosterone in patients with chronic glomerulonephritis.
results.text_hl: The present study compared the @DISEASE_Chronic_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D002908 @@@chronic@@@ effects of @CHEMICAL_efonidipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C066425 @@@efonidipine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ on @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005921 @@@chronic glomerulonephritis@@@.

citations.NLM: Ishimitsu T, Kameda T, Akashiba A, Takahashi T, Ohta S, Yoshii M, Minami J, Ono H, Numabe A, Matsuoka H. Efonidipine reduces proteinuria and plasma aldosterone in patients with chronic glomerulonephritis. Hypertens Res. 2007 Jul;30(7):621-6. PMID: 17785930
citations.BibTeX: @article{17785930, title={Efonidipine reduces proteinuria and plasma aldosterone in patients with chronic glomerulonephritis.}, author={Ishimitsu T and Kameda T and Akashiba A and Takahashi T and Ohta S and Yoshii M and Minami J and Ono H and Numabe A and Matsuoka H}, journal={Hypertens Res}, volume={30}, number={7}, pages={621-6}}

results.title: Association between peritoneal dialysate effluent leukocytosis and amlodipine besylate.
results.text_hl: This study describes a girl aged 2 years 9 months with @DISEASE_Kidney_Failure_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D007676 @@@end-stage renal disease@@@ resulting from crescent @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005921 @@@glomerulonephritis@@@ and severe @DISEASE_Nephritis_Interstitial @DISEASE_MESH:D009395 @@@interstitial nephritis@@@ who developed @DISEASE_Leukocytosis @DISEASE_MESH:D007964 @@@leukocytosis@@@ with a predominance of lymphocytes in the dialysate effluent, and in whom the effluent cell count normalized 1 week after discontinuation of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine besylate@@@ therapy.

citations.NLM: Lee F, Yu MC. Association between peritoneal dialysate effluent leukocytosis and amlodipine besylate. Am J Kidney Dis. 2009 Mar;53(3):e1-3. PMID: 19167800
citations.BibTeX: @article{19167800, title={Association between peritoneal dialysate effluent leukocytosis and amlodipine besylate.}, author={Lee F and Yu MC}, journal={Am J Kidney Dis}, volume={53}, number={3}, pages={e1-3}}

results.title: Comparative effects of selective T- and L-type calcium channel blockers in the remnant kidney model.
results.text_hl: Thus, at any given BP elevation, greater @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005921 @@@GS@@@ was seen in @CHEMICAL_Mibefradil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020748 @@@mibefradil@@@- and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@-treated @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ as compared with untreated @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Griffin KA, Picken M, Bakris GL, Bidani AK. Comparative effects of selective T- and L-type calcium channel blockers in the remnant kidney model. Hypertension. 2001 May;37(5):1268-72. PMID: 11358939
citations.BibTeX: @article{11358939, title={Comparative effects of selective T- and L-type calcium channel blockers in the remnant kidney model.}, author={Griffin KA and Picken M and Bakris GL and Bidani AK}, journal={Hypertension}, volume={37}, number={5}, pages={1268-72}}

results.title: Combined effects of an angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor and a calcium antagonist on renal injury.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: The results were consistent with the observation that a combination of benzepril and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ provides additional protection against @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@renal injury@@@ compared with that provided by @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ alone.

citations.NLM: Bakris GL, Griffin KA, Picken MM, Bidani AK. Combined effects of an angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor and a calcium antagonist on renal injury. J Hypertens. 1997 Oct;15(10):1181-5. PMID: 9350593
citations.BibTeX: @article{9350593, title={Combined effects of an angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor and a calcium antagonist on renal injury.}, author={Bakris GL and Griffin KA and Picken MM and Bidani AK}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={15}, number={10}, pages={1181-5}}

results.title: Combination therapy with irbesartan and efonidipine for attenuation of proteinuria in Dahl salt-sensitive rats.
results.text_hl: The @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005921 @@@glomerulosclerosis@@@ index was significantly attenuated by all active treatments except @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@.

citations.NLM: Takai S, Jin D, Sakonjo H, Miyazaki M. Combination therapy with irbesartan and efonidipine for attenuation of proteinuria in Dahl salt-sensitive rats. Hypertens Res. 2010 Sep;33(9):953-9. PMID: 20520612

results.title: Calcium channel blockers, either amlodipine or mibefradil, ameliorate renal injury in experimental diabetes.
results.text_hl: Increased @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005921 @@@glomerulosclerosis@@@ and @DISEASE_Nephritis_Interstitial @DISEASE_MESH:D009395 @@@tubulointerstitial injury@@@ in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ animals were attenuated by @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Mibefradil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020748 @@@mibefradil@@@.

citations.NLM: Ma G, Allen TJ, Cooper ME, Cao Z. Calcium channel blockers, either amlodipine or mibefradil, ameliorate renal injury in experimental diabetes. Kidney Int. 2004 Sep;66(3):1090-8. PMID: 15327403

results.title: Amlodipine is comparable to angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor for long-term renoprotection in hypertensive patients with renal dysfunction: a one-year, prospective, randomized study.
results.text_hl: Our aim was to prospectively compare the effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and ACEI (@CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@) on renal function in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@renal impairment@@@ due to chronic @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005921 @@@glomerulonephritis@@@ and @DISEASE_Essential_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000075222 @@@essential hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Kumagai H, Hayashi K, Kumamaru H, Saruta T. Amlodipine is comparable to angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor for long-term renoprotection in hypertensive patients with renal dysfunction: a one-year, prospective, randomized study. Am J Hypertens. 2000 Sep;13(9):980-5. PMID: 10981547
citations.BibTeX: @article{10981547, title={Amlodipine is comparable to angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor for long-term renoprotection in hypertensive patients with renal dysfunction: a one-year, prospective, randomized study.}, author={Kumagai H and Hayashi K and Kumamaru H and Saruta T}, journal={Am J Hypertens}, volume={13}, number={9}, pages={980-5}}

results.title: Antihypertensive agents and renal protection: calcium channel blockers.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@Amlodipine@@@ was more effective than @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ in reducing @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005921 @@@glomerulosclerosis@@@ in the group that was started on drug therapy eight weeks after surgery.

citations.NLM: Saruta T, Kanno Y, Hayashi K, Konishi K. Antihypertensive agents and renal protection: calcium channel blockers. Kidney Int Suppl. 1996 Jun;55():S52-6. PMID: 8743511
citations.BibTeX: @article{8743511, title={Antihypertensive agents and renal protection: calcium channel blockers.}, author={Saruta T and Kanno Y and Hayashi K and Konishi K}, journal={Kidney Int Suppl}, volume={55}, pages={S52-6}}

results.title: Disparate effects of angiotensin II antagonists and calcium channel blockers on albuminuria in experimental diabetes and hypertension: potential role of nephrin.
results.text_hl: A reduction in @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005921 @@@glomerulosclerosis@@@ was observed with @CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@valsartan@@@ monotherapy with less reduction in injury with the @CHEMICAL_Valsartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068756 @@@valsartan@@@ + @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ combination, despite a similar reduction in blood pressure.

citations.NLM: Davis BJ, Cao Z, de Gasparo M, Kawachi H, Cooper ME, Allen TJ. Disparate effects of angiotensin II antagonists and calcium channel blockers on albuminuria in experimental diabetes and hypertension: potential role of nephrin. J Hypertens. 2003 Jan;21(1):209-16. PMID: 12544453
citations.BibTeX: @article{12544453, title={Disparate effects of angiotensin II antagonists and calcium channel blockers on albuminuria in experimental diabetes and hypertension: potential role of nephrin.}, author={Davis BJ and Cao Z and de Gasparo M and Kawachi H and Cooper ME and Allen TJ}, journal={J Hypertens}, volume={21}, number={1}, pages={209-16}}

results.title: Hypertensive emergency successfully treated with metoprolol: a case report.
results.text_hl: The remainder of her evaluation confirmed the diagnosis of poststreptococcal @<m>DISEASE_Glomerulonephritis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005921 @@@glomerulonephritis@@@, and her blood pressure was, eventually, controlled with 3 medications: @CHEMICAL_Clonidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003000 @@@clonidine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Isradipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017275 @@@isradipine@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@.

citations.NLM: Liesemer K, Mullen N. Hypertensive emergency successfully treated with metoprolol: a case report. Pediatr Emerg Care. 2009 May;25(5):333-5. PMID: 19444030
citations.BibTeX: @article{19444030, title={Hypertensive emergency successfully treated with metoprolol: a case report.}, author={Liesemer K and Mullen N}, journal={Pediatr Emerg Care}, volume={25}, number={5}, pages={333-5}}
